title: Ticket #1721: COUNT_HYPERTHREAD_CPUS=False isn't working
description:
Turning off Condor's counting of hyperthread CPUs no longer seems to work when running on a Windows operating system. I have set: 

   COUNT_HYPERTHREAD_CPUS = False

in condor_config and have completely stopped and started Condor on the machine. And it still reports 2x the number of physical CPUs/cores in the machine. I have confirmed that hyperthreading is turned on the box.

Processors are Intel Xeon E5630 @ 2.53 -- there are 2 in the machine. See: http://ark.intel.com/Product.aspx?id=47924

Machine is running Windows 7 Professional edition.
remarks:
2012-Apr-11 07:28:55 by matt: 
$ grep -B3 -A1 COUNT_HYPERTHREAD_CPUS src/condor_sysapi/reconfig.cpp
#ifdef LINUX
    /* Should we count hyper threads? */
    _sysapi_count_hyperthread_cpus =
        param_boolean_int("COUNT_HYPERTHREAD_CPUS", 1);
#endif

2012-Apr-20 12:23:44 by ziliang:
Added patch to count CPUs while working around stupid CPU issue. Strangely enough, SYSTEM_LOGICAL_PROCESSOR_INFORMATION seems to be defined in the headers even if WINVER is set to XP, though we need to check if this is just the case for VS2010. Bumped to TJ for review.
